channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVID-19 cases in the US surpass 1 million, University of Queensland vaccine shows promise as Australian death toll stands at 89

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: The postponement comes after teachers rushed to get 61 per cent of course content online in time for the start of term this week.
item.title: 'Appalled': TAFE NSW puts pay rise for teachers on hold

item.description: Nurse by day and comedian (previously) by night, Catherine McClintock is chafing against the coronavirus lockdown – but you can help.
item.title: The nurse whose comedy career was cut off by COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: National death toll hits 89 after Victorian death; Queensland vaccine tests show promise; US cases surpass 1 million

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: national death toll rises and more 50,000 vehicles intercepted on the Gold Coast at the border

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: A man is expected to be charged over the alleged abduction of a 12-year-old girl from Thornleigh Skate Park on Tuesday.
item.title: Man arrested over alleged child abduction

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Australia Post is hiring casual workers and put hundreds of its posties behind the wheels of delivery vans to keep up with a huge surge in parcels as self-isolating Australians are buying more online.
item.title: Australia Post hires hundreds, puts posties into vans to deliver parcels

item.description: Only third cancellation in 165 years; police investigate hoax COVIDSafe text messages.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic will change the nature of retailing and workplaces, with unpleasant implications for landlords and property investors.
item.title: A retail property apocalypse is unfolding - and it's going to be unpleasant

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The NRL is reviewing two new videos which show Nathan Cleary flouting social distancing protocol and contradict the Penrith star's explanation.
item.title: NRL launches fresh probe into new Cleary videos

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Toilet paper hoarders, bushfires and drought drive up inflation as Australians prepare for a slide in incomes.
item.title: Drought, fires and virus push inflation to highest level in 6 years

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Umpires are keen to help the AFL, but with many working full-time jobs, moving to a quarantine hub model for an extended period of time will take some juggling.
item.title: Why the AFL's quarantine model could hit umpires the hardest

item.description: It's too easy to miss brilliant streaming shows, movies and documentaries. Here are the ones to hit play on or skip.
item.title: Amazon's latest show is a satirical Black Mirror look at VR afterlife

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: A strong cold front has whipped up damaging winds and heavy rain in Victoria's north-east and parts of East Gippsland, with the potential for flash flooding.
item.title: Cold front batters Victoria, Melbourne tops 2019 rainfall total already

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The publisher has announced another round of redundancies and said it will stop printing Harper's Bazaar, OK! and Elle.
item.title: Bauer Media suspends print magazines, cuts 70 jobs

item.dc:creator: Felicity Lewis
item.description: What can you do to stay happy and connected at home if you’re an older Australian? And what support is available?
item.title: What are older Australians up to during this pandemic?

item.description: There has been no quick fix for the Ebola crisis in DR Congo. But we can learn much in Australia from those who have learned to take outbreaks seriously.
item.title: Ebola, measles and now coronavirus: tackling multiple plagues in the Congo

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Should they re-open, despite expert warnings that doing so could lead to an increase of coronavirus deaths? Or should they remain closed? The decision weighs heavily on Albany, Georgia.
item.title: 'Honestly, we should be at home': Rapid re-opening divides a coronavirus hotspot

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Trevor Watts claims he was "catching up with neighbours in our respective driveways on Sunday afternoon", but police allege it was a more serious breach of COVID-19 rules.
item.title: MP told others to stay home days before he was fined at 'street party'

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Private schools say the federal deadline to bring forward funding if they resume classroom teaching is putting strain on teachers and parents.
item.title: Private schools warning on funding deadline

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says Australia's success in flattening the curve of the coronavirus epidemic does not mean the nation has succeeded, saying a low number of cases "is not good enough" if economic and wider health impacts are allowed to wreak havoc.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: PM says app will help transition to a 'COVID-safe economy'

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: A move to a big Japanese club and an Olympic berth - this should have been the best time of Thomas Deng's career. Now he's alone in a foreign country, playing a waiting game.
item.title: Alone in Japan, Thomas Deng's dream year is not turning out as planned

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Man who did odd jobs for 77-year-old Vicki Ramadan and told police he found his elderly neighbour's bloodied body will stand trial for her alleged murder.
item.title: Handyman who says he stumbled on neighbour's body faces murder trial

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Queensland Health will not follow a suggestion by a Griffith University infectious diseases expert to try to research why school students are not catching the coronavirus.
item.title: Queensland Health rules out antibody testing of schoolchildren

item.description: Western Bulldogs star Easton Wood's 2016 AFL premiership medal has been stolen, one of several items of sentimental value that police say were taken.
item.title: Bulldog's premiership medal among items of 'sentimental value' stolen

item.description: The Morrison government has placed staff, students and parents at independent schools "in an extraordinarily difficult and unfair position," the chief executive of Independent Schools Victoria says.
item.title: Private schools say they're being used as a 'wedge' in COVID-19 fight

item.description: Hard-hitting Australian batsman Chris Lynn has poured cold water on the nation's hopes of hosting the Twenty20 World Cup in October and November, saying it would be a "logistical nightmare" due to the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Twenty20 World Cup a 'logistical nightmare' amid pandemic

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Hong Kong casino tycoon Lawrence Ho has sold his remaining stake in Crown Resorts, ending a disastrous year-long attempt to gain a foothold in the James Packer-controlled gambling giant.
item.title: Lawrence Ho's Melco makes full retreat from Crown Resorts

item.description: Twenty years old Ahmad al Daki and his Syrian family can relate to the challenges brought on by the Coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Lockdown life from Syria to Sydney

item.dc:creator: James Polson
item.description: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian believes the actions of Latrell Mitchell, Josh Addo-Carr and Nathan Cleary have cast doubt on a May 28 resumption of the season.
item.title: Players' decisions have jeopardised NRL restart: Berejiklian

item.description: The AFL has reportedly stopped Western Australian clubs training in larger groups following complaints from Victorian teams.
item.title: WA clubs' head start prevented by AFL

item.description: FIFA's medical committee chairman Michel D'Hooghe says soccer should not be played until at least the start of September to limit the spread of the new coronavirus, as some of Europe's top leagues start the process to allow players to return to training
item.title: Soccer should not be played til September: FIFA official

item.description: Squats prevent the loss of bone and muscle that can lead to falls and fractures. Plus, they strengthen the pelvic floor.
item.title: Why everybody should be doing squats at home

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: Anxiety and depression arising out of unemployment "will be felt as long as we have economic fallout from COVID", mental health experts warn.
item.title: Australia urged to plan for coronavirus mental illness wave

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card at Warwick Farm.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Warwick Farm on Wednesday

item.description: Tom Moore has raised over $55 million to help the NHS treat coronavirus by completing laps of his garden with the help of a walking frame.
item.title: For 100th birthday, fundraiser 'Captain Tom' gets 125,000 well-wishing cards

item.description: The American painter has become "the unexpected poet of our moment" - but was he really that interested in alienation and detachment?
item.title: How artist Edward Hopper became the patron saint of social isolation

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The ASX now rising, up 51 points or 1 per cent, thanks to gains in financials, energy, and materials sector. Only healthcare and consumer staples are lower.
item.title: ASX up 1pc, energy and financials leading

item.description: Jenji Kohan, creator of Weeds and Orange Is the New Black, will produce the show, a comedy in which actors will film themselves from their own homes.
item.title: Orange Is the New Black creator making Netflix coronavirus series

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: The supermarket giant has seen a massive sales upswing in the March quarter as the pandemic outbreak saw customers rush into its stores.
item.title: Coles sales jump 13 per cent after coronavirus panic buying

item.dc:creator: Craig Mathieson
item.description: Being a successful TV host isn't just about keeping the plates spinning while the cameras are rolling; just ask Pete Evans, Scott Cam or George Calombaris.
item.title: As TV's host with the most, Hamish Blake puts others in the shade

item.description: An economic downturn almost always favours giants like Microsoft, Apple and Amazon. But this is amplified by a crisis that seems almost tailor-made for their future success.
item.title: Amazon, Apple: Company giants will dominate even more after pandemic

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian says a slight easing of social distancing rules across the state is not a holiday after a western Sydney childcare centre closed following a four-year-old child testing positive for coronavirus.
item.title: Sydney childcare centre closes after four-year-old tests positive to coronavirus

item.description: US cases of the novel coronavirus have surpassed one million, having doubled in 18 days, and making up one-third of all infections in the world.
item.title: US coronavirus death toll exceeds Vietnam War

item.dc:creator: Simon Evans
item.description: The paper suggests that due to strenuous exercise, elite athletes are more likely to inhale virus particles and direct them to the lower areas of the lung.
item.title: New research says athletes at risk of coronavirus spread to lungs

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Opposition trade spokeswoman Madeleine King has targeted high-profile Liberal MP Andrew Hastie, labelling him a political ideologue who is hijacking the China debate.
item.title: 'He's hijacking China debate': War of words erupts between WA MPs Andrew Hastie and Madeleine King

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As it happened: Australians download COVIDSafe app more than 2 million times; Victorian schools could reopen this term; nation's death toll stands at 88

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: With everyone's eyes on COVID-19, the Brisbane Metro has slipped $200 million over budget and Kingsford Smith Drive works are almost 12 months late.
item.title: Brisbane Metro $200m over budget, Kingsford Smith Drive 12 months late

item.description: The Australian sharemarket is set to rise when trading starts, but will battle a weak lead from Wall Street where investors pulled their money out of tech heavyweights.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set to rise despite weak lead from Wall Street

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: Attendance may not be essential but early school surveys predict the majority of students will return on Wednesday.
item.title: After fierce backlash, majority of WA students expected to return to school
